content.json:
# User and Entity Behavior Analytics
---

Welcome to the User and Entity Behavior Analytics workbook. The workbook provides a guided investigation
for entities based on open incidents, alerts and anomalies identified by the UEBA engine.

parameters.name: Help
parameters.label: Show Help
parameters.description: This will show some help information to help you understand the page you are on

content.json: See below how many incidents and alerts were created during the time range selected in the time range picker above. Likewise, you will see the number of Anomalies that were triggered. To learn more about Anomalies, please click [here](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/sentinel/work-with-anomaly-rules).

content.query:
SecurityIncident
| where TimeGenerated {TimeRange:query}
| summarize hint.strategy = shuffle arg_max(LastModifiedTime, *) by IncidentNumber
| where Status == "New" or Status == "Active"
| summarize IncidentCount=count() 
| project "New or active incidents", IncidentCount

let TotalAlertsCount = SecurityIncident
| where TimeGenerated {TimeRange:query}
| summarize hint.strategy = shuffle arg_max(LastModifiedTime, *) by IncidentNumber
| where Status == "New" or Status == "Active"
| mv-expand AlertIds
| extend AlertId = tostring(AlertIds)
| join kind= innerunique ( 
SecurityAlert | where TimeGenerated {TimeRange:query}) on $left.AlertId == $right.SystemAlertId
| where Status != "Resolved" or Status != "Dismissed" 
| summarize hint.strategy = shuffle arg_max(TimeGenerated,*), NumberOfUpdates = count() by SystemAlertId
| summarize AlertCount=count()
| project "New or active alerts",AlertCount;
TotalAlertsCount

Anomalies
| where TimeGenerated {TimeRange:query}
| summarize AnomalyCount=count()
| project "Anomaly Count", AnomalyCount

let TotalAnomaliesCount = Anomalies
| summarize by TenantId, TimeGenerated
| make-series count() default=0 on TimeGenerated from {TimeRange:start} to {TimeRange:end} step 1d
| extend series = "Anomalies Trend"
| project  series, count_, TimeGenerated ;
let TotalAlertsCount = SecurityIncident
|  where TimeGenerated {TimeRange:query}
| summarize hint.strategy = shuffle arg_max(LastModifiedTime, *) by IncidentNumber
| where Status == "New" or Status == "Active"
| mv-expand AlertIds
| extend AlertId = tostring(AlertIds)
| join kind= innerunique ( 
SecurityAlert |  where TimeGenerated {TimeRange:query}
) on $left.AlertId == $right.SystemAlertId
| summarize hint.strategy = shuffle arg_max(TimeGenerated,*), NumberOfUpdates = count() by SystemAlertId
| make-series count() default=0 on TimeGenerated from {TimeRange:start} to {TimeRange:end} step 1d
| extend series = "Alerts Trend"
| project  series, count_, TimeGenerated ;
let TotalIncidentsCount=SecurityIncident
| summarize hint.strategy = shuffle arg_max(LastModifiedTime, *) by IncidentNumber
| where Status == "New" or Status == "Active"
| make-series count() default=0 on TimeGenerated from {TimeRange:start} to {TimeRange:end} step 1d 
| extend series = "Incidents Trend"
| project series, count_, TimeGenerated;
TotalIncidentsCount | union TotalAlertsCount, TotalAnomaliesCount

content.json: Below you will find the total number of anomalies, plus how many of those have an account or an IP entity. Note that we are also counting anomalies that involve known hosts, but as  are currently not mapped as entities. The query for "Anomalies with hosts" counts the hosts that were parsed out of the following entity enrichments: "DeviceUncommonlyUsedByUser", "DeviceUncommonlyUsedAmongPeers", "DeviceUncommonlyUsedInTenant". See more about these [here](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/sentinel/ueba-reference#device-used-to-connect).

content.title: Total anomalies

content.query:
Anomalies
| where TimeGenerated {TimeRange:query}
| where tostring(Entities) contains '"Type":"account"'
| count
content.title: Anomalies with account entity

content.query:
Anomalies
| where TimeGenerated {TimeRange:query}
| where tostring(Entities) contains '"Type":"ip"'
| count
content.title: Anomalies with IP entity
Anomalies with a host

content.json:
Below you will find incidents that have entities involved in anomalies created up to 3 days prior to the incident creation.
Expand each entity to find the anomalies. When you click on the anomalies, you will visualize them on the right-hand side.
Finally, click on each of the anomalies to see anomaly reasons and device insights. Note that device insights are empty when there is no relevant information to show.

items.name: Help text for incidents with entities

content.query:
let TopUsersByAnomalies = Anomalies
    | mv-expand Entities
    | where tostring(Entities) contains '"Type":"account"'
    | project
        TimeGenerated,
        AnomalyID = Id,
        AadUserId=tostring(Entities.AadUserId),
        DisplayName=tostring(Entities.DisplayName),
        OriginalName=tostring(Entities.Name),
        AnomalyUPNSuffix=tostring(Entities.AnomalyUPNSuffix),
        OriginalUPNSuffix=tostring(Entities.UPNSuffix)
    | extend
        Name = iff(OriginalName contains '@', extract('(.*)@', 1, OriginalName), OriginalName),
        UPNSuffix = iff(OriginalUPNSuffix != "", OriginalUPNSuffix, extract('(.*)@(.*)', 2, OriginalName))
    | project-away OriginalName; 
let TopIPsByAnomalies= Anomalies
    | mv-expand Entities
    | where tostring(Entities) contains '"Type":"ip"'
    | project TimeGenerated, IPentity=tostring(Entities.Address), AnomalyID = Id;
let DeviceAnomalyName = dynamic(["DeviceUncommonlyUsedByUser", "DeviceUncommonlyUsedAmongPeers", "DeviceUncommonlyUsedInTenant"]);
let TopHostsByAnomalies =Anomalies
    | mv-expand AnomalyReasons
    | where tostring(AnomalyReasons.Name) in (DeviceAnomalyName)
    | extend DeviceRegex = tostring(extract("with ([A-Z0-9-]+) device", 1, Description))
    | extend DeviceName = tolower(DeviceRegex)
    | project-rename AnomalyID = Id;
let IncidentsWithEntities = SecurityIncident
    | summarize TimeGenerated=max(TimeGenerated), AlertIds=make_set(AlertIds) by IncidentNumber, IncidentUrl, Title
    | mv-expand AlertIds
    | project IncidentNumber, AlertId = tostring(AlertIds), TimeGenerated, IncidentUrl, Title 
    | join kind = inner ( 
        SecurityAlert
        | distinct SystemAlertId, Entities
        | mv-expand todynamic(Entities)
        | where Entities["Type"] =~ "account"
            or Entities["Type"] =~ "ip"
            or Entities["Type"] =~ "host"
        | project
            SystemAlertId,
            IPentity = tostring(tolower(Entities.Address)),
            DeviceName = tostring(tolower(Entities.HostName)),
            OriginalName = tostring(tolower(Entities.Name)),
            OriginalUPNSuffix = tostring(Entities.UPNSuffix),
            AadUserId = tostring(Entities.AadUserId)
        | extend
            Name = iff(OriginalName contains '@', extract('(.*)@', 1, OriginalName), OriginalName),
            UPNSuffix = iff(OriginalUPNSuffix != "", OriginalUPNSuffix, extract('(.*)@(.*)', 2, OriginalName))
        | project-away OriginalName, OriginalUPNSuffix
        )
        on $left.AlertId == $right.SystemAlertId
    | distinct
        TimeGenerated,
        IncidentNumber,
        IPentity,
        Name,
        AadUserId,
        DeviceName,
        UPNSuffix,
        IncidentUrl,
        Title
;
let TopUserIncidents = IncidentsWithEntities
    | join kind= inner (TopUsersByAnomalies) on $left.Name == $right.Name
    | where datetime_diff('day', TimeGenerated, TimeGenerated1) < 3 and datetime_diff('day', TimeGenerated, TimeGenerated1) > 0
    | summarize listOfAnomalyID = makelist(AnomalyID)
        by
        AadUserId= coalesce(Name, Name1),
        DisplayName,
        Name= coalesce(Name, Name1),
        AnomalyUPNSuffix,
        UPNSuffix = coalesce(UPNSuffix, UPNSuffix1),
        TimeGenerated,
        IncidentNumber,
        Title,
        IncidentUrl;
let TopIPIncidents = IncidentsWithEntities
    | join kind= inner (TopIPsByAnomalies) on $left.IPentity == $right.IPentity
    | where datetime_diff('day', TimeGenerated, TimeGenerated1) < 3 and datetime_diff('day', TimeGenerated, TimeGenerated1) > 0
    | summarize listOfAnomalyID = makelist(AnomalyID)
        by
        IPentity = coalesce(IPentity, IPentity1),
        TimeGenerated,
        IncidentNumber,
        Title,
        IncidentUrl;
let TopHostsIncidents = IncidentsWithEntities
    | join kind= inner (TopHostsByAnomalies) on $left.DeviceName == $right.DeviceName
    | where datetime_diff('day', TimeGenerated, TimeGenerated1) < 3 and datetime_diff('day', TimeGenerated, TimeGenerated1) > 0
    | summarize listOfAnomalyID = makelist(AnomalyID)
        by
        DeviceName = coalesce(DeviceName, DeviceName1),
        TimeGenerated,
        IncidentNumber,
        Title,
        IncidentUrl;
TopUserIncidents
| union TopIPIncidents, TopHostsIncidents
| extend Entity1 = coalesce(Name, AadUserId, IPentity, DeviceName)
| project
    TimeGenerated,
    IncidentNumber1 = strcat('üìù', IncidentNumber),
    Title,
    IncidentUrl,
    IPentity,
    DeviceName,
    AadUserId,
    Name, 
    UPNSuffix,
    DisplayName,
    Entity = strcat('Entity üîé', Entity1),
    listOfAnomalyID
| sort by TimeGenerated desc
content.title: Incidents with entities present in anomalies created in the 3 preceding days

items.name: Incidents with entities present in anomalies

content.query:
Anomalies
| where '{listOfAnomalyID}' contains Id
| project Description, AnomalyTemplateName, RuleStatus, RuleName, Score, AnomalyReasons, DeviceInsights
content.title: Anomalies of selected incident

content.query: {"version":"1.0.0","content":"{AnomalyReasonsP}","transformers":null}
content.title: Anomaly Reasons

content.query: {"version":"1.0.0","content":"{DeviceInsights}","transformers":null}
content.title: DeviceInsights

content.json: #### Use the tabs below to see users, IPs and hosts involved in incidents, alerts and anomalies. By selecting one user, IP or host from the list, you will visualize incidents and anomaly details from each one.
## Top users to investigate - by Incidents, alerts & anomalies
Click on a user from the list below to view incidents and anomalies where the user is present

content.query:
let TopUsersByAnomalies = Anomalies
| mv-expand Entities
| where tostring(Entities) contains '"Type":"account"'
| project AadUserId=tostring(Entities.AadUserId), DisplayName=tostring(Entities.DisplayName), OriginalName=tostring(Entities.Name), AnomalyUPNSuffix=tostring(Entities.AnomalyUPNSuffix), OriginalUPNSuffix=tostring(Entities.UPNSuffix)
| extend Name = iff(OriginalName contains '@', extract('(.*)@', 1, OriginalName), OriginalName), UPNSuffix = iff(OriginalUPNSuffix != "", OriginalUPNSuffix, extract('(.*)@(.*)', 2, OriginalName))
| summarize hint.strategy = shuffle AnomalyCount=count() by AadUserId, DisplayName, Name, AnomalyUPNSuffix, UPNSuffix;
let TopUsers = SecurityIncident
| summarize hint.strategy = shuffle arg_max(LastModifiedTime, *) by IncidentNumber
| mv-expand AlertIds
| project IncidentNumber, AlertId = tostring(AlertIds), TimeGenerated
| join kind= innerunique ( 
SecurityAlert
| mv-expand todynamic(Entities)
| where Entities["Type"] =~ "account"
| project SystemAlertId,  OriginalName = tostring(tolower(Entities.Name)), OriginalUPNSuffix = tostring(Entities.UPNSuffix), AadUserId = tostring(Entities.AadUserId)
 | extend Name = iff(OriginalName contains '@', extract('(.*)@', 1, OriginalName), OriginalName), UPNSuffix = iff(OriginalUPNSuffix != "", OriginalUPNSuffix, extract('(.*)@(.*)', 2, OriginalName))
 | project-away OriginalName, OriginalUPNSuffix
) on $left.AlertId == $right.SystemAlertId
| union TopUsersByAnomalies
| summarize hint.strategy = shuffle IncidentCount=dcount(IncidentNumber), AlertCount=dcount(AlertId), AnomalyCount=sum(AnomalyCount), AadUserId = make_set_if(AadUserId, AadUserId != "") by Name, UPNSuffix;
TopUsers
| sort by IncidentCount, AlertCount, AnomalyCount desc
content.title: Top users by incidents, alerts and anomalies

content.json: Select a user to view Incidents & Alerts & Anomalies breakdown

## Incidents Breakdown: {UserName}
---

content.query:
let IncidentUser = SecurityIncident
| summarize hint.strategy = shuffle arg_max(LastModifiedTime, *) by IncidentNumber
| mv-expand AlertIds
| extend AlertId = tostring(AlertIds), SecOpsOwner=tostring(Owner.assignedTo)
| join kind= innerunique ( 
SecurityAlert
| mv-expand todynamic(Entities)
| where Entities["Type"] =~ "account"
| project SystemAlertId,  OriginalName = tostring(tolower(Entities.Name)), OriginalUPNSuffix = tostring(Entities.UPNSuffix), AadUserId = tostring(Entities.AadUserId)
| extend Name = iff(OriginalName contains '@', extract('(.*)@', 1, OriginalName), OriginalName), UPNSuffix = iff(OriginalUPNSuffix != "", OriginalUPNSuffix, extract('(.*)@(.*)', 2, OriginalName))
| project-away OriginalName, OriginalUPNSuffix
) on $left.AlertId == $right.SystemAlertId
| where (Name == '{UserName}' and Name != "" and UPNSuffix == '{UserUPN}') or (AadUserId == '{UserObjectId}')
| where (Severity == '{Severity:value}' or '{Severity:value}' == "All") and (Status == '{Status:value}' or '{Status:value}' == "All");
IncidentUser
| summarize AlertCount=count(SystemAlertId) by  TimeGenerated, Title, Description, Severity, Status, SecOpsOwner, IncidentUrl, IncidentNumber

content.json:
## Anomalies Breakdown: {UserName}
---
Select an anomaly to view all the related details below

content.query:
Anomalies
| mv-expand Entities
| where tostring(Entities) contains '"Type":"account"'
| extend AadUserId=tostring(Entities.AadUserId), DisplayName=tostring(Entities.DisplayName), OriginalName=tostring(Entities.Name), AnomalyUPNSuffix=tostring(Entities.AnomalyUPNSuffix), OriginalUPNSuffix=tostring(Entities.UPNSuffix)
| extend Name = iff(OriginalName contains '@', extract('(.*)@', 1, OriginalName), OriginalName), UPNSuffix = iff(OriginalUPNSuffix != "", OriginalUPNSuffix, extract('(.*)@(.*)', 2, OriginalName))
| where (Name == '{UserName}' and Name != "" and UPNSuffix == '{UserUPN}') or (AadUserId == '{UserObjectId}')
| project TimeGenerated, AnomalyRule=AnomalyTemplateName, Description, Score, RuleStatus, Tactics, Techniques, Entities, AnomalyReasons, AnomalyDetails, ExtendedProperties, ActivityInsights, DeviceInsights, UserInsights, ExtendedLinks
content.noDataMessage: No anomalies associated with this user

tooltipFormat.tooltip: JSON object containing general information about the rule and algorithm that generated the anomaly as well as explanations for the anomaly.
The detailed explanation of the generated anomaly as JSON.
JSON object with additional data on the anomaly as key-value pairs.
Insights about the activites corresponding to the generated anomaly as JSON.
Insights about the devices corresponding to the generated anomaly as JSON.
Insights about the users corresponding to the generated anomaly as JSON.
List of links pointing to the data that generated the anomaly.

content.query: {"version":"1.0.0","content":"{AnomalyReasons}","transformers":null}
content.title: User Anomalies - AnomalyReasons

content.query: {"version":"1.0.0","content":"{DeviceInsights}","transformers":null}
content.title: User anomalies - DeviceInsights

content.json:
## Top hosts to investigate - by Incidents, alerts & anomalies
---
Clicking on an entity should load anomalies and incidents where the entity is present

content.title: Top hosts by incidents, alerts and anomalies

content.json: Select a host to view Incidents & Alerts & Anomalies breakdown

## Incidents Breakdown: {UserName}
---

content.query:
let IncidentswithHosts = SecurityIncident
| summarize hint.strategy = shuffle arg_max(LastModifiedTime, *) by IncidentNumber
| mv-expand AlertIds
| extend AlertId = tostring(AlertIds), SecOpsOwner=tostring(Owner.assignedTo)
| join kind= innerunique ( 
SecurityAlert
| mv-expand todynamic(Entities)
| where Entities["Type"] =~ "host"
| project SystemAlertId,  HostEntity = tostring(tolower(Entities.HostName))
) on $left.AlertId == $right.SystemAlertId
| where (HostEntity == '{Host}' and HostEntity != "")
| where (Severity == '{Severity:value}' or '{Severity:value}' == "All") and (Status == '{Status:value}' or '{Status:value}' == "All");
IncidentswithHosts
| summarize AlertCount=count(SystemAlertId) by TimeGenerated, Title, Description, Severity, Status, SecOpsOwner, IncidentUrl, IncidentNumber

content.json:
## Anomalies Breakdown: {UserName}
---
Currently, hosts are not mapped as entities in anomalies. In this workbook, they are being extracted from the Anomaly description.
Hover over each field on the anomalies below to see what it means

content.noDataMessage: No anomalies associated with this host

content.json:
## Top IPs to investigate - by Incidents, alerts & anomalies
---
Clicking on an entity should load anomalies and incidents where the entity is present

content.query:
let TopIPsByAnomalies= Anomalies
| mv-expand Entities
| where tostring(Entities) contains '"Type":"ip"'
| project IPentity=tostring(Entities.Address)
| summarize hint.strategy = shuffle AnomalyCount=count() by IPentity;
let TopIPs = SecurityIncident
| summarize hint.strategy = shuffle arg_max(LastModifiedTime, *) by IncidentNumber
| mv-expand AlertIds
| project IncidentNumber, AlertId = tostring(AlertIds), TimeGenerated
| join kind = innerunique ( 
SecurityAlert
| mv-expand todynamic(Entities)
| where Entities["Type"] =~ "ip"
| project SystemAlertId, IPentity = tostring(tolower(Entities.Address))
) on $left.AlertId == $right.SystemAlertId
| union TopIPsByAnomalies
| summarize IncidentCount=dcount(IncidentNumber), AlertCount=dcount(AlertId), AnomalyCount=sum(AnomalyCount) by IPentity;
TopIPs
| sort by IncidentCount, AlertCount, AnomalyCount, IPentity desc
content.title: Top IPs by incidents, alerts and anomalies

content.json: Select an IP to view Incidents & Alerts & Anomalies breakdown

## Incidents Breakdown: {UserName}
---

content.query:
let IncidentIP = SecurityIncident
| summarize hint.strategy = shuffle arg_max(LastModifiedTime, *) by IncidentNumber
| mv-expand AlertIds
| extend AlertId = tostring(AlertIds), SecOpsOwner=tostring(Owner.assignedTo)
| join kind= innerunique ( 
SecurityAlert
| mv-expand todynamic(Entities)
| where Entities["Type"] =~ "ip"
| project SystemAlertId,  IPEntity = tostring(tolower(Entities.Address))
) on $left.AlertId == $right.SystemAlertId
| where (IPEntity == '{IP}' and IPEntity != "")
| where (Severity == '{Severity:value}' or '{Severity:value}' == "All") and (Status == '{Status:value}' or '{Status:value}' == "All");
IncidentIP
| summarize AlertCount=count(SystemAlertId) by  TimeGenerated, Title, Description, Severity, Status, SecOpsOwner, IncidentUrl, IncidentNumber

content.json:
## Anomalies Breakdown: {UserName}
---
Hover over each field on the anomalies below to see what it means

content.query:
Anomalies
| mv-expand Entities
| where tostring(Entities) contains '"Type":"ip"'
| extend IPentity=tostring(Entities.Address)
| where (IPentity == '{IP}' and IPentity != "" )
| project TimeGenerated, AnomalyRule=AnomalyTemplateName, Description, Score, RuleStatus, Tactics, Techniques, Entities, AnomalyDetails, AnomalyReasons, ExtendedProperties, ActivityInsights, DeviceInsights, UserInsights, ExtendedLinks
content.noDataMessage: No anomalies associated with this IP
